SEARCH
Package Accounts

Class Account

java.lang.Object
Accounts.Account
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Account extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an account for a user with a unique staff ID and password. Provides functionalities to manage and authenticate user login credentials.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    Account(String staffID)
    Initializes an account with a specified staff ID and a default password.

  • Constructor Details

    • Account

      public Account(String staffID)
      Initializes an account with a specified staff ID and a default password.
      Parameters:
      staffID - The staff ID for this account.

  • Method Details

    • getStaffID

      public String getStaffID()
      Retrieves the staff ID associated with this account.
      Returns:
      The associated staff ID as a string.

    • setStaffID

      public void setStaffID(String staffID)
      Sets the staff ID for this account.
      Parameters:
      staffID - The staff ID to be set.

    • getPasswordHash

      public String getPasswordHash()
      Retrieves the hashed password for this account.
      Returns:
      The hashed password associated with the account, encoded as a Base64 string.

    • setPassword

      public void setPassword(String password)
      Sets a new password after hashing it.
      Parameters:
      password - The plain text password to be hashed and set.

    • validateLogin

      public boolean validateLogin(String password)
      Validates the login by comparing the provided password with the stored password hash.
      Parameters:
      password - The password to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the password is correct, false otherwise.

    • isUsingDefaultPassword

      public boolean isUsingDefaultPassword()
      Checks if the user is using the default password.
      Returns:
      true if the current password is the default, false otherwise.

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(Console console)
      Allows the user to change their password through the console interface. Ensures the new password is not the same as the current password and that the new password is confirmed by re-entry before changing it.
      Parameters:
      console - The console interface to interact with the user.
